_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Risk Management Plan - Executive Summary



Facility:    MFA Agri Service - Maysville

Location:    1302 S. Water St., Maysville, Mo.

Contact:     Josh Miller

Phone:          816-449-2128





1. The Facility Policy



    MFA Incorporated, and the employees of the MFA Agri Service in Maysville are committed to the prevention of any accidental release of anhydrous ammonia. If an accidental release should occur, the facility is prepared to work with the Maysville Fire Department, and other authorities, to mitigate any release and minimize the impact of the release to people and the environment.



2. Facility Information



    The primary activity at the facility is the receiving, storage and distribution of dry fertilizer and anhydrous ammonia for direct application as a crop nutrient. This facility also handles grain, pesticides, feed, seed and farm supply. 



3. The Accidental Release Prevention Program.



    The facility has implemented the provisions of "Safety Requirements for the Storage and Handling of Anhydrous Ammonia, K-61.1, 1999", published by The American National Standards Institute, Inc., and the standards of the U.S. Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA), 29 CFR 1910.111, "Storage and handling of Anhydrous Ammonia", and the Missouri Anhydrous Ammonia Law.



4. The Five-year Accident History



    There have been no accidental releases of anhydrous ammonia in the past five years that: have caused any deaths, injuries, or significant property damage at the facility; nor to our knowledge, have resulted in offsite deaths, injuries, evacuations, sheltering in place, property damage, or environmental damage.



5. The Emergency Response Program.



    The facility has;



    a. a written emergency action plan, in accordance with OSHA

       Standard, 29 CFR 1910.38;



    b. provided State and Local authorities with the emergency

       planning and community right-to-know information as

       required under SARA Title III (EPCRA);



    c. employees will not respond

to any release other than to

           activate an emergency shut-off while evacuating the facility.

           Local emergency responders will be notified to control any release.



6. Planned changes to improve safety.



    Safety improvement is an on-going process at the facility. Periodic evaluations are performed to assess the maintenance of safe conditions. Currently the facility is evaluating the requirements of CGA 2.1, 2014 and Process Management of Highly Hazardous Chemical and will make required upgrades needed.







    12/12/2016
